data.question: What is the full chemical name of the compound referred to as '1' in the text?
Who are the authors of the study on In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2?
data.answer: Ekaterina V. Anokhina, Marie Vougo-Zanda, Xiqu Wang, and Allan J. Jacobson

data.question: What type of structure is In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 described as in the text?
What is the synthesis temperature for In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2?
How many days was the reaction vessel heated to synthesize In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2?
What is the final solution pH after synthesizing In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2?
What happens to the guest H2BDC molecules in In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 when heated at 380−400 °C?
data.answer: The guest H2BDC molecules can be removed and replaced with other guests like water molecules.

data.question: Is the In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 structure flexible or rigid according to the text?
data.answer: Flexible, as indicated by the 'breathing' in response to the size and bonding characteristics of the guest species.

data.question: Does the synthesis of In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 involve hydrothermal reaction?
data.answer: Yes, it involves a hydrothermal reaction.

data.question: Are the guest H2BDC molecules in In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 ordered or disordered?
data.answer: Disordered among two positions related by a translation of ∼2.5 Å along the column axis.

data.question: Does the In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 structure exhibit catalytic activity?
data.answer: The text mentions that six but not the eight-coordinate systems show catalytic activity, but it does not specify if In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 itself exhibits catalytic activity.

data.question: Is the In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 compound synthesized in polycrystalline form?
data.answer: No, it is synthesized in single-crystal form.

data.question: The synthesis of In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 requires the use of HF.
The In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 structure is the first example of a hybrid inorganic coordination polymer−organic vernier structure.
The guest H2BDC molecules in In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 are removed at temperatures below 200 °C.
In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 has a 3D framework similar to previously reported M(OH)BDC compounds.
The In−OH−In angles in In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 are larger than those in the Fe3+ analogue Fe(OH)BDC·0.85py.
The synthesis of In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 does not involve deionized water.
The guest H2BDC molecules in In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 are interconnected to form infinite columns through hydrogen bonds.
The In(OH)BDC·0.75BDCH2 compound was synthesized without heating.
